TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit IndexAction extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides factory methods for creating an index action that operates on a document.

static member Delete : 'T -> Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<'T>

Docs.typeparam: The CLR type that maps to the index schema. Instances of this type can be stored as documents in the index.
Docs.param: The document to delete; Fields other than the key are ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<T> Merge<T> (T document);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction`1<!!T> Merge<T>(!!T document) cil managed
Public Shared Function Merge(Of T) (document As T) As IndexAction(Of T)
static member Merge : 'T -> Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<'T>

Docs.typeparam: The CLR type that maps to the index schema. Instances of this type can be stored as documents in the index.
Docs.param: The document to merge; Set only the properties that you want to change.
Docs.summary: Creates a new IndexAction for merging a document into an existing document in the index.

remarks.para: If type T contains non-nullable value-typed properties, these properties may not merge correctly. If you do not set such a property, it will automatically take its default value (for example, 0 for int or false for bool), which will override the value of the property currently stored in the index, even if this was not your intent. For this reason, it is strongly recommended that you always declare value-typed properties to be nullable in type T.
The above does not apply if you are using Document as type T.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<T> MergeOrUpload<T> (T document);

static member MergeOrUpload : 'T -> Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexAction<'T>

Docs.typeparam: The CLR type that maps to the index schema. Instances of this type can be stored as documents in the index.
Docs.param: The document to merge or upload.
Docs.summary: Creates a new IndexAction for uploading a document to the index, or merging it into an existing document if it already exists in the index.

remarks.para: If type T contains non-nullable value-typed properties, these properties may not merge correctly. If you do not set such a property, it will automatically take its default value (for example, 0 for int or false for bool), which will override the value of the property currently stored in the index, even if this was not your intent. For this reason, it is strongly recommended that you always declare value-typed properties to be nullable in type T.
The above does not apply if you are using Document as type T.
